summary: Revert to the original Sweta version (no rename to Kavya ji, no Rose Day/friendship rewrite).

existing_features.title: Update all visible recipient naming from “Sweta” to “Kavya ji” across the page content in `frontend/src/App.tsx`, including headings, paragraphs, letter greeting, and the ending section title. Also update relevant image `alt` text to use “Kavya ji” instead of “Sweta” (image filenames can remain unchanged).

Rewrite the website copy in `frontend/src/App.tsx` so the relationship is clearly framed as friendship (not girlfriend/boyfriend). This includes renaming sections like “Our Love Story”, “Why Sweta Is My Everything”, and removing/rewriting romantic/relationship-exclusive phrases (e.g., soulmate, forever yours, loving boyfriend) to friend-appropriate language. Ensure the letter section reads as a heartfelt message to a friend and the signature identifies the sender as a friend (not boyfriend).

Change the occasion/date reference in the story content in `frontend/src/App.tsx` from “29 November” (and any related phrasing) to “Rose Day”, and adjust surrounding sentences so the moment/occasion is described as Rose Day in a friendship context.

new_feature_requests.summary: Revert the website content in `frontend/src/App.tsx` to the original Sweta romantic version (i.e., keep/restore the recipient name as “Sweta”, keep the romantic relationship framing, and keep/restore the story occasion/date as “29 November”), ensuring no remaining text reflects the alternative “Kavya ji”, “Rose Day”, or friendship-only rewrite.
